text: All exposure variables were comprehensive for the period that the index patient was hospitalized at Hospital A. For example, did you enter the general ward, referred to whether or not the subject entered the general ward at least once at any time during the index patient's hospitalization. Variables were not all exclusive. For example subjects were asked whether they ever came within 1 meter of the index patient, and whether they ever did so without a mask (respirator). Further information pertaining to the number and duration of potential encounters was not requested due to time constraints and concerns about recall bias.
